column4: my applications panel is kind of messed up, can somebody hlep? i dont see anything i minimize to system tray..
right click on the panel and add the notification applet ...
it wont work.. when i removed volume control button it didnt go away. erUSUL
what didn't go away? you said minimized programs were no longer showing up in system tray

yes at first ntohing i minimized to system tray was showing up in system tray.. but now when i tried removing volume control icon and network manager icon.. they didnt go away, icons are like stuck there.
and when i add them agian, they d ont show up
have you opened up System Monitor and checked for a program eating up your resources ... force quit it
when i add any type of app to the panel the icon doesnt show up.. they are invisible.
make sure you don't have the entire panel taken up by the Windows applet
gnome-panel is tkaing up 9.0mb in system monitor
can i just add a new panel and not worry about this?
there's a way of restarting the gnome-panel ... very simple ... but I can't remember ... have you tried deleting the panels then readding them
i removed the icons on panel and readded but icons dont show up.. nor do the ones already there go away..  is there a way to just create a new panel?
right click on panel and choose delet panel or new panel
how do i add the network thing back on.. the thing that shows wireless connections avail.. and how im connected.. etc.
right click on a panel and choose "Add to Panel" ... you'll find all the panel applets there ... you're looking for notification area applet
yeah i got it, but iti still wont show the network thing.
try running this in a terminal: sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
